content: Ciao, perché dici che il processo di indicizzazione si blocca dopo pochi secondi? Di solito procede per diverso tempo in background senza nessuna segnalazione verso l'utente. L'operazione può richiedere parecchio tempo anche perché nel caso degli account IMAP una parte delle informazioni va recuperata dal server.

content: Ho per adesso risolto il problema, che in effetti non era legato all'indicizzazione, che si esegue effettivamente senza problemi. Il problema principale era windows defender che rileva trojan ovunque. Ho disabilitato temporaneamente WD e, una volta scaricato e aggiornato thunderbird, riattivato. Ora tutto sembra funzionare Curioso però che il problema nasca da un momento all'altro, non credo sia legato all'aggiornamento di thunderbird, ma non ne ho la certezza. Ad ogni modo posso lavorare, bene così

content:
Zimbra or the original sender is sending malformed mail.

The transfer type is defined as application/octet-stream in the image. According to the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), the group responsible for registering media types that is defined as follows; 

(RFC 2045 and 2046 published November 1996, subtype last updated April November 1996) 
The "octet-stream" subtype is used to indicate that a body contains arbitrary binary data.  The set of currently defined parameters is: 
 (1)   TYPE -- the general type or category of binary data.       This is intended as information for the human recipient       rather than for any automatic processing. 
 (2)   PADDING -- the number of bits of padding that were       appended to the bit-stream comprising the actual       contents to produce the enclosed 8bit byte-oriented       data.  This is useful for enclosing a bit-stream in a       body when the total number of bits is not a multiple of       8. 
Both of these parameters are optional. 
An additional parameter, "CONVERSIONS", was defined in RFC 1341 but has since been removed.  RFC 1341 also defined the use of a "NAME" parameter which gave a suggested file name to be used if the data were to be written to a file.  This has been deprecated in anticipation of a separate Content-Disposition header field, to be defined in a subsequent RFC. 
The recommended action for an implementation that receives an "application/octet-stream" entity is to simply offer to put the data in a file, with any Content-Transfer-Encoding undone, or perhaps to use it as input to a user-specified process. 
To reduce the danger of transmitting rogue programs, it is strongly recommended that implementations NOT implement a path-search mechanism whereby an arbitrary program named in the Content-Type parameter (e.g., an "interpreter=" parameter) is found and executed using the message body as input.

See https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/octet-stream

A PDF file which this image claims the content based on the file name (something that has no relevance in this setting except to suggest a default when saving the file, it should be transmitted as application/pdf https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/pdf

I would expect the arbitrary binary date to not be forwarded at all beyond the initial receipt. It is an elevated risk of containing a virus of some sort as the file name suggested and content type are unrelated to one another.

Pomocou neho je možné vkladanie prostých textov, ale aj HTML textov priamo v otvorenom emailu a to v mieste aktuálne postavenému kurzoru. Každému takto vytvorenému textu môžete priradiť aj klávesovú skratku. Mám taký dojem, že v jednej skupine je možné vytvoriť až 25 takýchto textov. Skupín môžete vytvoriť hocikoľko.

content:
Děkuji. To hlavní toto řeší !!! Sice to neumí používat přímo již vytvořený HTML soubor, ale není problém použít HTML zápis v souboru a vložit ho do textového pole se zapnutím HTML formátování.

Výhoda HTML souborů byla, že při změně obsahu souboru se změnil výsledek u kohokoliv kdo soubor používá. Tedy jeden soubor může sloužit jako šablona pro více uživatelů, což je výhodou pro jednotné šablony na firemní úrovni pro více uživatelů. Nyní tedy při změně textu či formátování bude nutné provést export šablon a následně provést import šablon u ostatních, kdo s nimi pracují. Je to práce navíc, ale asi OK.

Jsak jsem napsal, je to práce navíc, ale je to akceptovatelné, neb předpokladem je, že toto se nebude provádět často.

content:
Chapala said
ALSO THIS A VERY POOR WAY TO PROVIDE USER SUPPORT. NEED DIRECT CONTACT WITH TECHNICAL SUPPORT.

As Mzla the company that has employees to develop Thunderbird does not offer any technical support at all, you might want to reconsider your criticism of this peer support forum. It might not meet your expercations, but it is all that exists at an official level.

The latest version of Thunderbird (115) will not allow access to my primary email account (arwilson@arwilson.com) on Windows 10. It will access to the account on my android phone. What is wrong and how can it be fixed. If no immediate response I am going to remove the latest version and install a previous on and prohibit automatic updates.

1. It is extremely difficult on a on a windows decive without server policies to prohibit updates. Simple as that.

2. If you install a previous version it will refuse to accept your use of your current profile. You can force the use, but anything converted for the new version will be lost.

3. Ok you can not get mail from what appear to be a custom domain. I can not even begin to guess why it does not work as you have offered nothing that might give a clue. As I an anyone else in this forum knows what you tell us and what we can surmise. we currently know. "The latest version of Thunderbird (115) will not allow access to my primary email account."

For us to better comment on this issue, we will need some more information.

Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX

content:
Just in case someone is reading this and has never created a 'userChrome.css' file before, I'm including all the necessary information.

Please check in Thunderbird to see if a setting needs switching on.

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button
  • In search type : legacy
  • look for this line: toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets
  • If it is set as 'false' :
  • click on the far right arrow type icon to toggle from 'false' to say * 'TRUE'

Now Do this: In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • in 'Application Basics' - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'

A new window opens showing the contents of your profile name folder.

  • Exit Thunderbird now. This is important.
  • In the 'profile name ' folder create a new folder and call it 'chrome'. The spelling is important - note it is all lower case.
  • Then open a simple text editor program such as 'Notepad'.
  • Copy all the text between the lines below and paste it into 'Notepad'. 
@import url("chrome://messenger/content/unifiedtoolbar/unifiedToolbarWebextensions.css"); @namespace html url("http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml");  /*     * Collapsed read thread, but the thread contains unread , set text to bold black on top level thread */  #threadTree tbody .children.collapsed[data-properties~="hasUnread"]   :where(td, .subject-line) {   text-decoration: none !important;   font-weight: bold !important;   color: #000000 !important; }
  • Save the file as 'userChrome.css' - note the spelling of this is important - all lower case except the C.
  • Save it in the 'chrome' folder. - see attached image as guide.

Check that file really is called 'userChrome.css' and not 'userChrome.css.txt' - it has to be saved as a Cascading Style Sheet (css) and not a text document. So if you see 'userChrome.css.txt' - no problem - just rename it by removing the .txt - you will get ask are you sure as it may effect things - just say yes because you really do want to do it.

Start Thunderbird
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Toad-Hall said

DonDowner said
just fyi for anyone else reading this, I removed the `color: #000000 !important;` so that the subject line is compatible with Dark Mode.

Or if you are only using dark mode then set color to use #ffffff which is white.

Hello Toad-Hall,

I had removed that `color: #000000 !important;` line altogether, which works well when in Light mode by changing the subject to bold and text in black. However, I just noticed it doesn't work well in Dark mode (I have my Mac set to Auto, so it changes at night and in the morning again), as the subject text is bold but the color is gray (same as the read emails) and not white like the regular unread emails. Therefore it's very hard to distinguish the collapsed threads with unread emails.

I tried setting the color to #ffffff, but that only works in Dark mode.

Any idea how to have the subject text color change to black in Light mode, and to white (not gray) in Dark mode) ?

Thanks
creator: gastonvedani

creator: rabotareferat

content:
For me this worked 

   * Collapsed read thread, but the thread contains unread, set headline text to bold black
  • /
  1. threadTree tbody .children[data-properties~="hasUnread"] .subject-line { 
 font-weight: bold !important;

}


it marked subject line of a tread bold if the tread has any unread messages.
creator: rabotareferat

content:
re :Any idea how to have the subject text color change to black in Light mode, and to white (not gray) in Dark mode) ?

Sorry for delay. Try this, it works for me.

For the 'color' line in the code I previously supplied use this: 

color:  var(--thread-pane-unread-color) !important;

content:
Do you mean the Message List shows more emails so the Message Pane is too low and difficult to read the email content ?

You want to be able to raise the splitter at top of Message Header so fewer emails in list are displayed but more of the Message Pane is shown so you can see more email content.

Please read this question and answer to help solve this problem. I used 150px which worked for me, but some people have found 100px suits them.

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1423733
creator: Toad-Hall

creator: modemjunkie

content: I accidentally reposted my reply. I don't see a way to delete it.
creator: modemjunkie

content:
modemjunkie said
The View > Font Size function no longer works on my Windows 11 desktop. The problem began only yesterday (11/24) I have now updated to Thunderbird 115.50. That didn't help. I can barely make out the menu items or lists. Any help will be appreciated.

Need some info: What 'Density' setting is selected?

  • View > Density > ?

What px size is shown in this location?

  • Menu icon (3 lines) > Font Size > ?px

Check the following is set to default:

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button
  • In search type: pixels
  • look for: layout.css.devPixelsPerPx

By default it should be a negative number -1.0 If you see any other number then do this:

  • click on the pencil icon on the right
  • Completely remove whatever number is in that area
  • type the negative number: -1.0
  • click on the tick icon to save.

Confirm you have the default -1.0 setting.

Whilst in this area check this:

  • In search type : uifont
  • look for : mail.uifontsize

By default it should say zero 0 which means the default of 12px is being used. What do you see ?
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
You have had issues with font size and I'm aware that you have posted your frustrations about this issue in other forums without success. Using 'Windows to mess about with font size will effect everything on your computer, so it is not a solution.

In order to get a real solution you need to work with me because I have sorted out several cases were things were very much out of synch. That means you need to post requested information and it would be helpful if you did not alter things otherwise I'm offering instructions which may not work.

So far, I've asked you to set up a certain settings so I know we are working from a good starting point, but that's all - I've not offered you any solution.

Please tell me the answers to questions.

But first put your Windows settings back to where they should be.

In Thunderbird. What 'Density' setting is selected?

  • View > Density > ?

What px size is shown in this location?

  • Menu icon (3 lines) > Font Size > ?px

There are various areas that need to be checked when it comes to font size settings in Thunderbird.

Confirm this setting : layout.css.devPixelsPerPx is set to the default negative -1.0 What is the number you see for this: mail.uifontsize

Need to understand all other font settings.

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • scroll down to 'Important Modified Preferences'
  • Look for where it starts with : font
  • Copy ALL in the list for items that start with 'font'
  • Paste the information into this forum question.


Tools > Addons & Themes OR 'Menu app icon > Addons & Themes What theme you are using in Thunderbird?

content: I use mailwasher pro and all it does is have an option to start the desired email client. It checks mail independently of the client. content:
The height (for Classic or Wide View) or width (for Vertical View) of the threads pane (message list) can have a minimum value, allowing the Message Pane to be larger. This is done with css: 

/* height, width of threads pane */ #threadPane {   min-height: 75px !important;   min-width: 75px !important; }


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the number as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)

content:
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages describes Thunderbird's spam settings. But it only applies to messages which have the junk/spam icon set.

Things other than Thunderbird can put messages in the spam folder and they will not have Thunderbird's junk icon set. Thunderbird has no control over how these messages get put in the spam folder.

content:
As per your Troubleshooting Information there are two brighthouse.com accounts. Do both have the problem?

Antivirus: Norton 360

I'd still think Norton is playing a role in this. These are some generic suggestions to avoid problems with anti-virus software.

Create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_how-to-find-your-profile

Don't let your anti-virus software scan incoming and outgoing messages.

Don't let your anti-virus software scan attachments.

Don't let your anti-virus software intercept your secure connection to the server.

Remove any add-ons your anti-virus software may have installed in Thunderbird.

Keep it working. http://kb.mozillazine.org/Keep_it_working_-_Thunderbird

And last but not least, backup your Thunderbird profile on a regular basis. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_backing-up-a-profile

content:
About problem #1 - I saw a message at the bottom of the window "Moved 47 messages from Inbox to Trash. Then I did a filter search for some messages, selected three, and deleted them. The message at the bottom of the window now reads "Moved 50 messages from Inbox to Trash. So It appears that this message is correct (but misleading). I have, indeed , moved 50 messages to Trash since the last time the message was refreshed. Now the message line reads "No messages to download", so I assume that TB has just looked for new messages and found none. I did another filter, and I found 32 messages to move to Trash. After the movement, the message at the bottom says, "Moved 32 messages from Inbox to Trash".

I do not remember the message at the bottom of the screen remaining in previous releases of TB. I do not mind if the message remains at the bottom, but when I move n messages to Trash, the message should state that n messages were moved; the count should not be cumulative,

content:
Hope I'm not hijacking this thread.

I am very grateful for the whole Mozilla project, and use both Firefox and the (now independent?) Thunderbird. Have made several donations previously, but recent security upgrade came with a lot of detriments. Not quite enough to drop Thunderbird, but VERY disappointing that someone felt it necessary to add all sorts of glitzy noise - what Edward Tufte calls "chartjunk" - that degrade my user experience. I assume that other folks are having the same or related issues.

I just now allowed another update. "About" now says: 

  115.5.2 (32-bit)   -   Release notes   -   Thunderbird is up to date

I'm running Windows 10 64 Pro. Is there supposed to be a 64-bit version of TB? Happy for any security improvement; have not seen any performance/usability benefit.

- On average, it now required 2x to 3x number of movements/clicks for every task.

- Whole folder trees now open when making a single-click selection. Real PITA to have to collapse it all again to see the the folder pane top level.

- Yet, often have to double click just to select (not open) another message or folder, then click again to open.

- Extremely annoying: system defaults to Threaded sort, no matter how many times I make the change to Unthreaded on any folder. Made the suggested change in advanced settings, but it still reverts to Threaded.

- Userchrome is apparently now non-functional, and default settings are visually unpleasant and make it harder to get work done. E.g., the grey circles with unread count are distracting and a waste of real estate, but I haven't found a way to disable the "feature." No userchrome means no way to remove wasted screen space, e.g. reducing menu-bar height.

- Columns auto-space in inconvenient ways. When I re-set them to my preference, there seems to be no global option - and they quickly revert anyway.

- Single-account download has been removed. This is very inconvenient when one has many accounts and wants to do a quick re-check on just one, e.g. to get an incoming urgent message.

- When selecting/opening a folder, it seem to wind up at some random point in list, rather than top (by my sort, most recent).

- Context menus ever more crowded and (I suspect) largely irrelevant to most users. There hasn't been a compatible context-menu editor extension for some time; this really should be a native feature when the list has grown to dozens of items.

Sure hope the next revision corrects some of these, and - especially - restores UserChrome functionality.
creator: cten

content: I have 64-bit Thunderbird installed in Win 10 Pro 64-bit.

content:
Personal Address Book is abook.sqlite (.mab in older versions) and Collected Addresses is history.sqlite (or .mab), both in the profile folder. You might also see other .mab files or abook-1.sqlite, abook-2.sqlite etc.

Tools/Import, Import from file, address books....
creator: sfhowes

content:
'Customize Toolbar' is from the Message Header Toolbar Customize add-on.

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/msghdr-toolbar-customize/versions/
creator: sfhowes

content: Thank you!
creator: margochester

content:
1. Tools/Import, Import from a file, Import address books, sqlite format, select abook.sqlite or history.sqlite, or abook-1.sqlite, abook-2.sqlite... from the old profile.

2. Copy persdict.dat from the old profile.

3. Copy msgFilterRules.dat files from Mail/<popservername> and ImapMail/<imapservername> to similar folders in new profile.

content:
I don't have a solution for your problem. In any case, based on the error message in your last screenshot, this looks more like a networking problem, than something related to SQLite files.

Beyond that, typically a network calendar is being accessed via CalDAV. Is this what you're using? Thunderbird supports CalDAV natively, there is no need for any add-ons.

they say that it’s a Thunderbird issue.

Of course they do.

Also, that because I’m using IMAP that the calendar is stored locally on my machine.

I don't see how IMAP (for email) is being related to the calendar.
